title: Tunisian Sign Language Recognition Under Real Constraints
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: Designing a lightweight pipeline for Tunisian Sign Language recognition in healthcare contexts.
content:
## Context
Communication barriers remain a major obstacle in healthcare access.

## Problem Statement
TunSL datasets are small, imbalanced, and noisy. Models must run on constrained hardware.

## Why Standard Vision Models Fail
End-to-end video models are computationally expensive and brittle in uncontrolled environments.

## Design Principles
- Skeletal representations
- Temporal abstraction
- Efficiency-first design

## System Overview
The pipeline extracts keypoints, encodes temporal motion, and classifies isolated gestures.

## Technical Choices
Keypoint-based representations reduce noise and improve generalization.

## Data & Evaluation
Class imbalance is addressed via feature-space augmentation rather than naive oversampling.

## Limitations
The system currently focuses on isolated signs, not continuous signing.

## Deployment
Designed for low-latency inference on consumer devices.

## Lessons Learned
Accessibility requires efficiency, not scale.

## Conclusion
TunSL recognition must be engineered, not merely trained.
